newsitem.title: USA: Iraqi crude sold spot on U.S. Gulf Coast - traders.
newsitem.headline: Iraqi crude sold spot on U.S. Gulf Coast - traders.

text.p: The first Iraqi oil to hit the U.S. spot crude market since sanctions were imposed over six years ago was recently sold by trading firm Bayoil, traders confirmed Wednesday.

Bayoil has sold two Very Large Crude Carriers (VLCCs) totalling four million barrels of Basrah Light on a delivered basis to Gulf Coast refiners, including Clark Refining and Marketing and Mobil Corp, traders said.
Houston-based Bayoil has a six-month contract with Iraq for 30,000 barrels per day (bpd) under the U.N. oil-for-food program that started December 10.
